document.discussion_title: Previewing Day 4 of women’s volleyball prelims: U.S. aims to keep cruising | WWLP.com
document.topic_text: Click to share on Pinterest (Opens in new window) The U.S. women’s volleyball team looks to shift into cruise control as the quarterfinals await just around the corner. Following wins against Puerto Rico, the Netherlands and Serbia, Team USA sits atop Pool B with eight points entering the fourth of five preliminary matches Friday. Now the U.S. team will take on an Italy squad that has yet to win a set in Rio at 2 p.m. Friday . The upstart Netherlands squad immediately follows the Americans with a match against Puerto Rico at 4 p.m. Here is the rest of Friday’s schedule:
